PyPedal.pyp_newclasses.NewPedigree Class Reference

The NewPedigree class is the main data structure for PyP 2.0.0Final. More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

def __init__
 __init__() initializes a NewPedigree object.
def __add__
 Method to add two pedigrees and return a new pedigree representing the merged pedigrees.
def __sub__
 Method to subtract two pedigree and return a new pedigree representing the first pedigree without any animals shared in common with the second pedigree, or: A - B = A - (A B).
def union
 __union__() is an alias to NewPedigree.__add__().
def intersection
 __intersection__() returns a PyPedal pedigree object which contains the animals that are common to both input pedigrees.
def load
 load() wraps several processes useful for loading and preparing a pedigree for use in an analysis, including reading the animals into a list of animal objects, forming lists of sires and dams, checking for common errors, setting ancestor flags, and renumbering the pedigree.
def oldsave
 oldsave() writes a PyPedal pedigree to a user-specified file.
def save
 save() writes a PyPedal pedigree to a user-specified file.
def savegraph
 savegraph() save a pedigree to a file as an adjacency list.
def savegedcom
 savegedcom() save a pedigree to a file in GEDCOM 5.5 format.
def savegenes
 savegenes() save a pedigree to a file in GENES 1.20 (dBase III) format.
def savedb
 savedb() saves a pedigree to a database table in ASDx format for NewAnimals and LightAnimals.
def preprocess
 preprocess() processes a pedigree file, which includes reading the animals into a list of animal objects, forming lists of sires and dams, and checking for common errors.
def fromgraph
 fromgraph() loads the animals to populate the pedigree from a DiGraph object.
def fromnull
 fromnull() creates a new pedigree with no animal records in it.
def fromanimallist
 fromanimallist() populates a NewPedigree with instances of NewAnimal objects.
def tostream
 tostream() creates a text stream from a pedigree.
def renumber
 renumber() updates the ID map after a pedigree has been renumbered so that all references are to renumbered rather than original IDs.
def addanimal
 addanimal() adds a new animal of class NewAnimal to the pedigree.
def delanimal
 delanimal() deletes an animal from the pedigree.
def updateidmap
 updateidmap() updates the ID map after a pedigree has been renumbered so that all references are to renumbered rather than original IDs.
def printoptions
 printoptions() prints the contents of the options dictionary.
def simulate
 simulate() simulates an arbitrary pedigree of size n with g generations starting from n_s base sires and n_d base dams.

Detailed Description

The NewPedigree class is the main data structure for PyP 2.0.0Final.

  other,
  filename = False,
  debugLoad = False 
)

Method to subtract two pedigree and return a new pedigree representing the first pedigree without any animals shared in common with the second pedigree, or: A - B = A - (A B). 

Method to subtract two pedigree and return a new pedigree representing the
first pedigree without any animals shared in common with the second pedigree,
	or: A - B = A - (A \cap B).

Parameters:
selfReference to current object.
animalIDID of the new animal to be added to the pedigree.
sireIDSire ID of the new animal to be added to the pedigree.
damIDDam ID of the new animal to be added to the pedigree.
Return values:
1on success, 0 on failure

Definition at line 1831 of file pyp_newclasses.py.

def PyPedal.pyp_newclasses.NewPedigree.delanimal (   self,
  animalID 
)

delanimal() deletes an animal from the pedigree.

Note that this method DOES not update the metadata attached to the pedigree and should only be used if that is not important. As of 04/10/2006 delanimal() is intended for use by pyp_metrics/mating_coi() rather than directly by users.

Parameters:
selfReference to current object
animalIDID of the animal to be deleted
Return values:
1on success, 0 on failure

Definition at line 1721 of file pyp_newclasses.py.

def PyPedal.pyp_newclasses.NewPedigree.intersection (   self,
  other,
  filename = False 
)

__intersection__() returns a PyPedal pedigree object which contains the animals that are common to both input pedigrees. 

__union__() is an alias to NewPedigree::__add__().

If there are no animals in common between the two pedgrees, a value of false is returned.

Parameters:
pedobj_bAnother PyPedal pedigree.
filenameThe file to which the new pedigree should be written
Return values:
Anew PyPedal pedigree containing the animals that are common to both input pedigrees. 
intersection() returns a PyPedal pedigree object which contains the animals that are common to
both input pedigrees. If there are no animals in common between the two pedgrees, a value
of false is returned.

Definition at line 544 of file pyp_newclasses.py.

def PyPedal.pyp_newclasses.NewPedigree.load (   self,
  pedsource = 'file',
  pedgraph = 0,
  pedstream = '',
  animallist = False 
)

load() wraps several processes useful for loading and preparing a pedigree for use in an analysis, including reading the animals into a list of animal objects, forming lists of sires and dams, checking for common errors, setting ancestor flags, and renumbering the pedigree.

Parameters:
selfReference to current object.
pedsourceSource of the pedigree ('file'|'graph'|'graphfile'|'db').
pedgraphDiGraph from which to load the pedigree.
pedstreamStream of text from which to load the pedigree.
animallistLiost of NewAnimal objects from which to create a pedigree.
Return values:
None
load() wraps several processes useful for loading and preparing a pedigree for
use in an analysis, including reading the animals into a list of animal objects,
forming lists of sires and dams, checking for common errors, setting ancestor
flags, and renumbering the pedigree.

Definition at line 667 of file pyp_newclasses.py.

def PyPedal.pyp_newclasses.NewPedigree.oldsave (   self,
  filename = '',
  outformat = 'o',
  idformat = 'o' 
)

oldsave() writes a PyPedal pedigree to a user-specified file.

The saved pedigree includes all fields recognized by PyPedal, not just the original fields read from the input pedigree file.

Parameters:
selfReference to current object.
filenameThe file to which the pedigree should be written.
outformatThe format in which the pedigree should be written: 'o' for original (as read) and 'l' for long version (all available variables).
idformatWrite 'o' (original) or 'r' (renumbered) animal, sire, and dam IDs.
Return values:
Asave status indicator (0: failed, 1: success) 
oldsave() writes a PyPedal pedigree to a user-specified file.  The saved pedigree
includes all fields recognized by PyPedal, not just the original fields read
from the input pedigree file.

  textstream = '',
  dbstream = '' 
)

preprocess() processes a pedigree file, which includes reading the animals into a list of animal objects, forming lists of sires and dams, and checking for common errors.

Parameters:
selfReference to current object
textstreamString containing animal records
dbstreamList of tuples of animal records
Return values:
None
Preprocess a pedigree file, which includes reading the animals into a list, forming lists of sires and dams, and checking for common errors.

Definition at line 1794 of file pyp_newclasses.py.

def PyPedal.pyp_newclasses.NewPedigree.save (   self,
  filename = '',
  pedformat = 'asd',
  sepchar = ' ',
  append = False,
  write_list = False,
  originalID = False 
)

save() writes a PyPedal pedigree to a user-specified file.

The saved pedigree includes all fields recognized by PyPedal, not just the original fields read from the input pedigree file.

Parameters:
selfReference to current object.
filenameThe file to which the pedigree should be written.
pedformatPedigree format string for the pedigree to be written.
sepcharCharacter used to separate columns in the output pedigree file.
appendAppend animal records to an existing file instead of creating a new one.
write_listOptional list of animal records to save. The default is to save all animals.
originalIDsave original IDs or renumbered IDs.
Return values:
Asave status indicator (0: failed, 1: success) 
save() writes a PyPedal pedigree to a user-specified file.  The saved pedigree
includes all fields recognized by PyPedal, not just the original fields read
from the input pedigree file.

)

selfReference to current object.
dropBoolean indicating if existing data should be kept (False) or deleted (True); the default is False.
Return values:
_savedb_statusBoolean indicating if the pedigree was successfully saved.

for NewAnimals and LightAnimals.

Definition at line 1158 of file pyp_newclasses.py.

def PyPedal.pyp_newclasses.NewPedigree.simulate (   self)

simulate() simulates an arbitrary pedigree of size n with g generations starting from n_s base sires and n_d base dams.

This method is based on the concepts and algorithms in the Pedigree.sample method from Matvec 1.1a. The arguments are read from the pedigree object's options dictionary.

Parameters:
selfReference to current object
Return values:
None
Simulate simulates an arbitrary pedigree of size n with g generations
starting from n_s base sires and n_d base dams.  This method is based
on the concepts and algorithms in the Pedigree::sample method from
Matvec 1.1a (src/classes/pedigree.cpp), although all of the code in
this implementation was written from scratch.
